subject: Simsonn pro x ultra not working correct
description_text:
Dear Support Team,

I have been using my Simsonn pedals for a few days now, but they are not
working as they should.
Whenever I try to configure the pedals in a game, one of the sensors keeps
flickering.
When I check in the Game Controller Settings, I notice that the X rotation
is constantly fluctuating.
Could you please advise me on how to resolve this issue?

Kind regards,
Chess Goudberg

conversations.body_text: Hi Chess Goudberg,     You can also try using SIMSONN Manager 2.1.1. In the software interface, click the “Restore” button, then click “Save”. After that, reinsert the USB and test whether the RX axis has been successfully disabled.      Additionally, for the white raw signal, you can use the Offset function to zero it out and set a 5% deadzone. This will not affect the blue signal, which is the one used by the game.   https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BAdSWa1bxmbPksj9Hlzuo8bl7_bM8ixr/view?usp=drive_link

Dear Support Team,

The issue with the RX axis has been resolved, but now the LED lighting and
the three haptic motors are no longer working.
Could you please advise me on how to resolve this issue?

Kind regards,
Chess Goudberg


Op wo 1 okt 2025, 11:51 schreef service@simsonn.com

Hi Chess Goudberg,    Please send me a full screenshot of the pedal vibration test interface in Simsonn Manager 2.1.1 so I can check whether a firmware update is required. Also, please note that the pedal’s USB should not be connected through a hub — it must be plugged directly into a USB 3.0 (blue) port on the back of your PC to ensure stable operation. You may also provide a video via Google Drive to demonstrate the issue, and we will assist you in restoring it, so no need to worry. Please make sure the video access permission is set to viewable.

Dear Support team,

As requested, I am sending you the screenshot of the Simsonn manager 2.1.1.
The USB is directly connected to the computer through a USB 3.0 port.

Kind regards,
Cess Goudberg

Op do 2 okt 2025 om 06:06 schreef service@simsonn.com
Hi Chess Goudberg,    In the software, go to:  Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals → firmware → pedals-proxultra-old.sfu  to complete the firmware update.

Dear Support Team,

It worked! Thank you!

However, I’m now experiencing another issue with the VAM and VAM Pro haptic
motors.
As you can see in the video, sometimes when SimHub shows a spike, the motor
doesn’t react. Other times, when the spike is over, the motor keeps
vibrating.

This also happens in-game — the motors sometimes continue vibrating even
after I stop driving.

Could you please advise me on how to resolve this issue?


Kind regards,
Chess Goudberg

Unfortunately, it didn’t solve the problem.

Op di 7 okt 2025 om 11:44 schreef service@simsonn.com

Hi Chess Goudberg,    That should be fine now. Please try to bind it again.  If the issue persists, please record a video and send it to me via Google Drive, making sure to grant access permission so I can review it.

Dear Support Team,

The issue with the RX axis has already been resolved. However, I’m now
experiencing problems with the VAM and VAM Pro motors. As shown in the
video, when I’m racing and hit a curb, the motors keep vibrating for the
entire race.

Additionally, when I test them in Simsonn Manager or SimHub, their behavior
seems inaccurate — sometimes they trigger correctly when I press the test
button, but other times they stay active continuously.

Could you please help me identify what might be causing this issue?

Best regards,
Chess Goudberg

Op di 7 okt 2025 om 12:07 schreef service@simsonn.com

Hi Chess Goudberg,  Could you please tell me which game you’re using and which telemetry options are enabled? Also, please make sure the device is plugged directly into the rear USB 3.0 (blue) port of your PC. Note that SimHub and Simsonn Manager cannot be opened at the same time, as this will cause conflicts and unstable vibration or signal behavior.

Hi Chess Goudberg,     I just ran a test without launching iRacing and directly tested the VAM Pro on the brake port. The ABS effect triggered vibrations over a hundred times continuously, and there were no stoppage or abnormal issues during the entire test.

Hi Chess Goudberg,     This was just my temporary testing method, and the environment is the same as yours. Even after clicking more than 100 times, the vibration did not fail to stop. I believe the issue might be related to USB connection or insufficient power supply, which may prevent the “stop” command from being successfully sent to the ProX Ultra controller.   https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GwM4PeMUvTPuKNcgp1hE5cOv97XJOLYG/view?usp=sharing

Dear Support Team,

I am currently playing iRacing and using telemetry features such as Road
Rumble, ABS, and Gear Shift. The device is connected via a rear USB 3.0
(blue) port on my PC.

I’m running SimHub, but I experience the same issue when using Simsonn
Manager 2.1.2. Could you please advise how to resolve a possible USB
connection or insufficient power supply problem?

I noticed in your demo video that your setup works perfectly, but
unfortunately, mine does not function the same way.
